title: How to Make an Airsoft Field

steps.title: Gather equipment to build with.
steps.content: Gather equipment to build with. If you want a top-notch field and you have money to spare you can buy the wood and sandbags and such that you need. BUT, the better thing to do would probably be to find scrap wood and barrels, and anything you find on the side of the road. You might want to bring friends to help build it.

steps.title: Find a good place to play near your home or neighborhood.
steps.content: Find a good place to play near your home or neighborhood. A large backyard, abandoned shack or you could buy a wide lot near your house, this is ideal for a large-scale assault. If you own property (or have permission to use it) with woods this would be good too, as most cover will already be there and you won't have to do as much work. Remember It could be illegal in your area on public land.

steps.title: Dig trenches and fox holes for cover.
steps.content: Dig trenches and fox holes for cover.

steps.title: Stack up and put out any stacked up tires, old barrels, tables, palettes, sandbags or other solid objects for cover.
steps.content: Stack up and put out any stacked up tires, old barrels, tables, palettes, sandbags or other solid objects for cover.

steps.title: Mark any objectives clearly with smoke, a painted emblem, a sticker, or anything Be Creative!
steps.content: Mark any objectives clearly with smoke, a painted emblem, a sticker, or anything Be Creative! if applicable.

steps.title: Make bunkers out of old sheds or build new ones out of wood
steps.content: Make bunkers out of old sheds or build new ones out of wood

steps.title: Put trees or small bushes to hide behind.
steps.content: Put trees or small bushes to hide behind.

steps.title: Be aware there are no animals occupying the place.
steps.content: Be aware there are no animals occupying the place. You do not want to kill someone's pet.

steps.title: Make different landmarks that everyone can identify.
steps.content: Make different landmarks that everyone can identify. So, put a lot of plywood in one area, and you can call it 'the fort'. Have a lot of open area, then call it 'the field'. Make the field distinguishable, so you can communicate effectively.

steps.title: Make sure if its in your backyard, no one shoots one of your windows.
steps.content: Make sure if its in your backyard, no one shoots one of your windows.
